intro: Stenopadus chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté mountain fern, is a rare and endemic species found in the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a waxy coating. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and deforestation.
